controller

Class ServiceController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.ServiceController

  • public class ServiceController
extends java.lang.Object
    Interface between WebServer endpoints and back end services (auth and storage)

      • getLocationsFor

        public java.util.List<LocationInfo> getLocationsFor(java.lang.String authtoken,
                                                    java.lang.String user,
                                                    java.time.ZonedDateTime start,
                                                    java.time.ZonedDateTime end)
                                             throws HTTPException
        Parameters:
        authtoken -
        user - the user whose locations we are getting
        start - the time of the earliest location we want
        end - the time of the last location we want
        Returns:
        the set of all locations for this user within the time range defined by start and end
        Throws:
        HTTPException - if auth fails or if user trying to access a non-friend

        user -
        list - a list of LocationInfo to add to storage

                             throws HTTPException
        Makes a new group with the given name
        Parameters:
        authtoken -
        groupName - the desired name for this group (note does not have to be unique among all groups)
        Returns:
        a unique id for this new group
        Throws:
        HTTPException - if auth or storage fails

                   throws HTTPException
        Parameters:
        authtoken -
        id - the id of the group whose info we want
        Returns:

        Throws:

      • getLocationsForGroup

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<LocationInfo>> getLocationsForGroup(java.lang.String authtoken,
                                                                                         java.lang.String groupId,
                                                                                         java.time.ZonedDateTime start,
                                                                                         java.time.ZonedDateTime end)
                                                                                  throws HTTPException
        Parameters:
        authtoken -
        groupId -
        start - the time of the earliest desired location
        end - the time of the last desired location
        Returns:
        a map from username to their locations within the time range start to end
        Throws:
        HTTPException - if you are not in the group or if auth fails
